discover.name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
discover.address: Tarkwa Bay (off Lagos Harbour), Lagos State, Nigeria
discover.description: A sheltered, palm‑fringed beach only accessible by boat; popular for swimming, surfing and picnic days out.

discover.name: Lekki Conservation Centre
discover.address: Opposite Chevron Roundabout, Lekki‑Epe Expressway, Lagos State, Nigeria
discover.description: 78 ha of protected mangrove swamp with the continent’s longest canopy walkway, bird hides and guided nature trails.

discover.name: Makoko Floating Village Tour
discover.address: Makoko waterfront, Lagos Lagoon, Mainland, Lagos, Nigeria
discover.description: A guided canoe exploration of Lagos’s iconic 'Venice of Africa'—a stilts community with floating schools and fishing life.

discover.name: LUFASI Nature Park
discover.address: KM 10 Lagos–Ikorodu Road, Ogudu GRA, Lagos, Nigeria
discover.description: A 50‑acre forest‑reserve‑style park, with walking paths, small zoo, picnic areas and children’s playground—a peaceful urban escape.

discover.name: Elegushi Royal Beach
discover.address: KM 17 Lekki–Epe Expressway, Lekki Area, Lagos, Nigeria
discover.description: A lively private beach with street food stalls, pony and bicycle rides, beachfront bars and weekend parties.

discover.name: Nike Art Gallery
discover.address: Gordon Road, Ikoyi, Lagos State, Nigeria
discover.description: One of Africa’s largest art galleries showing paintings, textiles and sculptures; visitors can join creative workshops.

discover.name: New Afrika Shrine
discover.cost: Event cover ₦2,000–₦5,000 (live tribute or Afrobeat nights)
discover.description: Fela Kuti’s iconic open‑air venue (rebuilt), with live Afrobeat bands, dance, food stalls and Nollywood screenings.

discover.name: Freedom Park Lagos
discover.address: 1 Broad Street, Lagos Island, Lagos State, Nigeria
discover.cost: Free to enter; concerts, festivals charged ₦1,000–₦5,000
discover.description: A restored colonial prison-turned public space with gardens, art exhibits, open‑air amphitheatre and cultural markets.

discover.name: Balogun Market
discover.address: Balogun Market (around 62 Davies St), Lagos Island, Lagos, Nigeria
discover.cost: Free entry; cost of goods only
discover.description: One of Lagos’s busiest shopping labyrinths for textiles, crafts and street food—haggling and vibrant street‑scene included.

discover.name: Terra Kulture
discover.address: Plot 1376 Tiamiyu Savage Street, Off Ahmadu Bello Way, Victoria Island, Lagos, Nigeria
discover.description: A showcase of Nigerian creativity—gallery space, bookstore, restaurant and a theatre hosting plays and music performances.
